sn5.4:1.2: Then, in the morning, the bhikkhunī Vijayā dressed …
sn5.4:1.3: … she sat down at the foot of a tree for the day’s abiding.
sn5.4:1.4: Then Māra the Evil One, desiring to arouse fear, trepidation, and terror in the bhikkhunī Vijayā, desiring to make her fall away from concentration, approached her and addressed her in verse:
sn5.4:2.2: And I too am a youth in my prime.
sn5.4:2.3: With the music of a fivefold ensemble,
sn5.4:2.4: Come, noble lady, let us rejoice ”
sn5.4:3.1: Then it occurred to the bhikkhunī Vijayā:
sn5.4:3.4: This is Māra the Evil One … desiring to make me fall away from concentration. ”
sn5.4:3.5: Then the bhikkhunī Vijayā, having understood, “This is Māra the Evil One, ” replied to him in verses:
sn5.4:4.3: I offer them right back to you,
sn5.4:4.4: For I, O Māra, do not need them.

sn5.4:7.1: Then Māra the Evil One, realizing “The bhikkhunī Vijayā knows me, ” sad and disappointed, disappeared right there.
